author: jens4601
content:
One of the biggest benefits (in my opinion) of (a) getting it as rlp in the first place and (b) getting all of them at once is that you can check the validity of them really easily, before even rlp decoding. A light client (or other applications that doesn't fully trust its full node) would have to convert it to the consensus encoding first before they can be used for checking their integrity.

In addition to that: If I remember correctly, Go-Ethereum's GraphQL endpoint also gives them back in consensus encoding. Not sure about the other clients if they support GraphQL in the first place.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: I'm kind of surprised we use any `debug` RPCs in hive tests, I always thought of that namespace as very client specific and typically more "wild west" so my suggestion would be if we standardize this RPC we move it to `eth_getRawReceipts` as part of the process.  Or maybe a new `raw` namespace?
